intro: Beilschmiedia opposita, commonly known as the red-leaf beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring smooth, dark bark and glossy, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Beilschmiedia opposita produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by edible, orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
